qas.question: In which sea was a large amount of naval vessels sent in order to remove Cilician pirates?
Around how many ships were sent into service from Greek cities?

answers.text: as many as a thousand ships

qas.question: Who was ultimately responsible for the naval ships that were sent to the English Channel?
What was the driving force behind the revitalization of the Roman naval forces?
What aspect of the Roman military saw a decline in size after the subjugation of the Mediterranean?

context: After having declined in size following the subjugation of the Mediterranean, the <a4_0>Roman navy<a4_0/> underwent short-term upgrading and revitalisation in the late Republic <a3_0>to meet several new demands<a3_0/>. Under <a2_0>Caesar<a2_0/>, an invasion fleet was assembled in the English Channel to allow the invasion of Britannia; under Pompey, a large fleet was raised in the <a0_0>Mediterranean Sea<a0_0/> to clear the sea of Cilician pirates. During the civil war that followed, <a1_0>as many as a thousand ships<a1_0/> were either constructed or pressed into service from Greek cities.
